It’s a universal translator of value for anyone. Some people will use it to exchange rewards points for airline miles, one gift card for another, fiat for Bitcoin, etc. There’s no way to keep certain people out or limit what is exchanged. It’s just a tool.

Everybody who owned Bitcoin received BitcoinCash when the fork happened. Nobody was “gotten rid of.” Bitcoin and Ripple are both tools. Period. Some people will use them for good, some for bad, and many won’t even bother to learn.

How would you secure a Blockchain without miners who charge in Bitcoin?

Not really. You can trust the Blockchain because it has more hashing power than any other system and it has more hashing power than any other system because of Bitcoin. If you remove Bitcoin the Blockchain disappears, just like if you remove TCP/IP the Internet disappears.
